column4: how can I fix that: I bought a  new LCD and settings are still for the old one. like section "screen" Monitor   "ADI MS-5P+" ....
This is important couse I wanna make the newest LCD for my default monitor, not the old one
If you haven't modified your X configuration, you can run "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" to create a new one
I've just recently installed XGl.. but that's not x
Oh, if you're running xgl, I can't help you, sorry.
I am not tunnig it..
Video card's bus identifier:  Do I leave this default " PCI:1:0:0" ?
run the lspci command and search for your video card. It will tell you the correct PCI numbers in the first column.
which one do I use
That doesn't look right.
Pastebin the entire output of lspci, would you?
ok
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/1964/
01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: nVidia Corporation NV34 [GeForce FX 5500]  (rev a1) <--- that's the one.
So I put 01:00.0
leave it as PCI:1:0:0
You can leave most of those as default values.
Nope
What is your keyboard layout? Is it qwerty?
don't know what I have at the moment but it works fine
If it works fine, don't touch that setting, then.
I bought samsung, model is SyncMaster 940b, so what shoul I put in Identifier for the monitor:
That doesn't matter. The identifier is merely a name. You can call it Fred if you want.
gave it recentlz
